definition: to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate

sentences.english: Now he's Vice Chairman, Editor-Auditor of PLA Publishing Press.
sentences.chinese: 现为解放军出版社副社长，编审。

sentences.english: "National examination system to learn by teaching" expert members of the first series of the pipeline.
sentences.chinese: 《全国易学考试统用教材》第一辑的编审专家委员。

sentences.english: Budget and balance are effective means for controlling the construction cost.
sentences.chinese: 认真做好工程预结算编审工作是控制造价的有效保证。

sentences.english: The story editor will make any changes to the script that he deems necessary.
sentences.chinese: 编审将对他认为需要调整的地方做出修改。

sentences.english: She refereed for a periodical a few years ago.
sentences.chinese: 几年前她为一期刊担任编审。

sentences.english: Each time I began to read and edit the manuscript, I felt more peaceful.
sentences.chinese: 每次我开始编审书稿后，我感觉更和平。

sentences.english: The senior editor emphasized that this article needed further polishing.
sentences.chinese: 编审特别提到，这篇文章需要进一步润色。

definition: editor in charge (abbr. for 責任編輯|责任编辑[ze2 ren4 bian1 ji2])
(publishing) (abbr. for 美術編輯|美术编辑[mei3 shu4 bian1 ji2]) layout and graphics/graphic design/art editor/graphic designer
to supervise the manufacture of/to supervise the shooting of films/executive producer (film)
chief editor (of newspaper)/abbr. for 總編輯|总编辑
to gather up/to collect/to edit/to compile
